intro: Brachystelma medusanthemum, commonly known as the starry star-of-Bethlehem, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptability to arid environments. The plant features a short, branching stem with fleshy, cylindrical leaves that help store water. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and typically white or pale blue, appearing in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
